trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery: Performance and scaling testing: On-premises to on-premises
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery: Performance and scaling testing: On-premises to on-premises

trans-unit.source: This article discusses the testing of the performance impact of replication using Azure Site Recovery in an on-premises to on-premises deployment.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses the testing of the performance impact of replication using Azure Site Recovery in an on-premises to on-premises deployment.

trans-unit.source: Performance and scaling testing: On-premises to on-premises
trans-unit.target: Performance and scaling testing: On-premises to on-premises

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Site Recovery orchestrates and manages replication of your primary data center to a second location so that your data is backed up and recoverable in the case of planned and unplanned outages.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Site Recovery orchestrates and manages replication of your primary data center to a second location so that your data is backed up and recoverable in the case of planned and unplanned outages.

trans-unit.source: You can backup up on-premises private clouds located on System Center Virtual Machine Manager (VMM) to another on-premises location, or to Microsoft Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: You can backup up on-premises private clouds located on System Center Virtual Machine Manager (VMM) to another on-premises location, or to Microsoft Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: To perform the replication, VMM uses Hyper-V Replica, a replication mechanism that is built into Hyper-V in Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: To perform the replication, VMM uses Hyper-V Replica, a replication mechanism that is built into Hyper-V in Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: It provides asynchronous replication of Hyper-V virtual machines between two hosting servers.
trans-unit.target: It provides asynchronous replication of Hyper-V virtual machines between two hosting servers.

trans-unit.source: Any server workload that can be virtualized in Hyper-V can be replicated.
trans-unit.target: Any server workload that can be virtualized in Hyper-V can be replicated.

trans-unit.source: Replication works over any ordinary IP-based network Hyper-V Replica works with standalone servers, failover clusters, or a mixture of both.
trans-unit.target: Replication works over any ordinary IP-based network Hyper-V Replica works with standalone servers, failover clusters, or a mixture of both.

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses the testing of the performance impact of replication using Azure Site Recovery in an on-premises to on-premises deployment.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses the testing of the performance impact of replication using Azure Site Recovery in an on-premises to on-premises deployment.

trans-unit.source: It provides detailed information about the parameters and configuration settings used in the test, shows the test deployment step, and provided detailed test results.
trans-unit.target: It provides detailed information about the parameters and configuration settings used in the test, shows the test deployment step, and provided detailed test results.

trans-unit.source: The goal is to examine how Azure Site Recovery performs during steady state replication.
trans-unit.target: The goal is to examine how Azure Site Recovery performs during steady state replication.

trans-unit.source: Steady state replication occurs when virtual machines have completed initial replication and are synchronizing delta changes.
trans-unit.target: Steady state replication occurs when virtual machines have completed initial replication and are synchronizing delta changes.

trans-unit.source: It’s important to measure performance using steady state because it’s the state in which most virtual machines remain unless unexpected outages occur.
trans-unit.target: It’s important to measure performance using steady state because it’s the state in which most virtual machines remain unless unexpected outages occur.

trans-unit.source: The test deployment consisted of two on-premises sites with a VMM server in each.
trans-unit.target: The test deployment consisted of two on-premises sites with a VMM server in each.

trans-unit.source: Both VMM servers are registered in an Azure Site Recovery vault.
trans-unit.target: Both VMM servers are registered in an Azure Site Recovery vault.

trans-unit.source: This test deployment is typical of a head office/branch office deployment, with head office acting as the primary site and the branch office as the secondary or recovery site.
trans-unit.target: This test deployment is typical of a head office/branch office deployment, with head office acting as the primary site and the branch office as the secondary or recovery site.

trans-unit.source: Created virtual machines using VMM templates.
trans-unit.target: Created virtual machines using VMM templates.

trans-unit.source: Started virtual machines and capture baseline performance metrics over 12 hours.
trans-unit.target: Started virtual machines and capture baseline performance metrics over 12 hours.

trans-unit.source: Created clouds on primary and recovery VMM servers.
trans-unit.target: Created clouds on primary and recovery VMM servers.

trans-unit.source: Configured cloud protection in Azure Site Recovery, including mapping of source and recovery clouds.
trans-unit.target: Configured cloud protection in Azure Site Recovery, including mapping of source and recovery clouds.

trans-unit.source: Enabled protection for virtual machines and allow them to complete initial replication.
trans-unit.target: Enabled protection for virtual machines and allow them to complete initial replication.

trans-unit.source: Waited a couple of hours for system stabilization.
trans-unit.target: Waited a couple of hours for system stabilization.

trans-unit.source: Captured performance metrics over 12 hours, ensuring that all virtual machines remained in an expected replication state for those 12 hours.
trans-unit.target: Captured performance metrics over 12 hours, ensuring that all virtual machines remained in an expected replication state for those 12 hours.

trans-unit.source: Measure the delta between the baseline performance metrics and the replication performance metrics.
trans-unit.target: Measure the delta between the baseline performance metrics and the replication performance metrics.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica asynchronously tracks changes to a log file with minimum storage overhead on the primary server.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica asynchronously tracks changes to a log file with minimum storage overhead on the primary server.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica utilizes self-maintained memory cache to minimize IOPS overhead for tracking.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica utilizes self-maintained memory cache to minimize IOPS overhead for tracking.

trans-unit.source: It stores writes to the VHDX in memory and flushes them into the log file before the time that the log is sent to the recovery site.
trans-unit.target: It stores writes to the VHDX in memory and flushes them into the log file before the time that the log is sent to the recovery site.

trans-unit.source: A disk flush also happens if the writes hit a predetermined limit.
trans-unit.target: A disk flush also happens if the writes hit a predetermined limit.

trans-unit.source: The graph below shows the steady state IOPS overhead for replication.
trans-unit.target: The graph below shows the steady state IOPS overhead for replication.

trans-unit.source: We can see that the IOPS overhead due to replication is around 5% which is quite low.
trans-unit.target: We can see that the IOPS overhead due to replication is around 5% which is quite low.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica utilizes memory on the primary server to optimize disk performance.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica utilizes memory on the primary server to optimize disk performance.

trans-unit.source: As shown in the following graph, memory overhead on all servers in the primary cluster is marginal.
trans-unit.target: As shown in the following graph, memory overhead on all servers in the primary cluster is marginal.

trans-unit.source: The memory overhead shown is the percentage of memory used by replication compared to the total installed memory on the Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: The memory overhead shown is the percentage of memory used by replication compared to the total installed memory on the Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica has minimum CPU overhead.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica has minimum CPU overhead.

trans-unit.source: As shown in the graph, replication overhead is in the range of 2-3%.
trans-unit.target: As shown in the graph, replication overhead is in the range of 2-3%.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica uses a small amount of memory on the recovery server to optimize the number of storage operations.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica uses a small amount of memory on the recovery server to optimize the number of storage operations.

trans-unit.source: The graph summarizes the memory usage on the recovery server.
trans-unit.target: The graph summarizes the memory usage on the recovery server.

trans-unit.source: The memory overhead shown is the percentage of memory used by replication compared to the total installed memory on the Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: The memory overhead shown is the percentage of memory used by replication compared to the total installed memory on the Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: The amount of I/O operations on the recovery site is a function of the number of write operations on the primary site.
trans-unit.target: The amount of I/O operations on the recovery site is a function of the number of write operations on the primary site.

trans-unit.source: Let’s look at the total I/O operations on the recovery site in comparison with the total I/O operations and write operations on the primary site.
trans-unit.target: Let’s look at the total I/O operations on the recovery site in comparison with the total I/O operations and write operations on the primary site.

trans-unit.source: The graphs show that the total IOPS on the recovery site is
trans-unit.target: The graphs show that the total IOPS on the recovery site is

trans-unit.source: Around 1.5 times the write IOPS on the primary.
trans-unit.target: Around 1.5 times the write IOPS on the primary.

trans-unit.source: Around 37% of the total IOPS on the primary site.
trans-unit.target: Around 37% of the total IOPS on the primary site.

trans-unit.source: Effect of replication on network utilization
trans-unit.target: Effect of replication on network utilization

trans-unit.source: An average of 275 MB per second of network bandwidth was used between the primary and recovery nodes (with compression enabled) against an existing bandwidth of 5 GB per second.
trans-unit.target: An average of 275 MB per second of network bandwidth was used between the primary and recovery nodes (with compression enabled) against an existing bandwidth of 5 GB per second.

trans-unit.source: Effect of replication on virtual machine performance
trans-unit.target: Effect of replication on virtual machine performance

trans-unit.source: An important consideration is the impact of replication on production workloads running on the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: An important consideration is the impact of replication on production workloads running on the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If the primary site is adequately provisioned for replication, there shouldn’t be any impact on the workloads.
trans-unit.target: If the primary site is adequately provisioned for replication, there shouldn’t be any impact on the workloads.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica’s lightweight tracking mechanism ensures that workloads running in the virtual machines are not impacted during steady-state replication.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica’s lightweight tracking mechanism ensures that workloads running in the virtual machines are not impacted during steady-state replication.

trans-unit.source: This is illustrated in the following graphs.
trans-unit.target: This is illustrated in the following graphs.

trans-unit.source: This graph shows IOPS performed by virtual machines running different workloads before and after replication was enabled.
trans-unit.target: This graph shows IOPS performed by virtual machines running different workloads before and after replication was enabled.

trans-unit.source: You can observe that there is no difference between the two.
trans-unit.target: You can observe that there is no difference between the two.

trans-unit.source: The following graph shows the throughput of virtual machines running different workloads before and after replication was enabled.
trans-unit.target: The following graph shows the throughput of virtual machines running different workloads before and after replication was enabled.

trans-unit.source: You can observe that replication has no significant impact.
trans-unit.target: You can observe that replication has no significant impact.

trans-unit.source: The results clearly show that Azure Site Recovery, coupled with Hyper-V Replica, scales well with minimum overhead for a large cluster.
trans-unit.target: The results clearly show that Azure Site Recovery, coupled with Hyper-V Replica, scales well with minimum overhead for a large cluster.

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery provides simple deployment, replication, management and monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery provides simple deployment, replication, management and monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica provides the necessary infrastructure for successful replication scaling.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica provides the necessary infrastructure for successful replication scaling.

trans-unit.source: For planning an optimum deployment we suggest you download the [Hyper-V Replica Capacity Planner](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39057).
trans-unit.target: For planning an optimum deployment we suggest you download the [Hyper-V Replica Capacity Planner](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=39057).

trans-unit.source: The primary site has a cluster containing five Hyper-V servers running 470 virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The primary site has a cluster containing five Hyper-V servers running 470 virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machines run different workloads, and all have Azure Site Recovery protection enabled.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machines run different workloads, and all have Azure Site Recovery protection enabled.

trans-unit.source: Storage for the cluster node is provided by an iSCSI SAN.
trans-unit.target: Storage for the cluster node is provided by an iSCSI SAN.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster server has four network cards (NICs) of one Gbps each.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster server has four network cards (NICs) of one Gbps each.

trans-unit.source: Two of the network cards are connected to an iSCSI private network and two are connected to an external enterprise network.
trans-unit.target: Two of the network cards are connected to an iSCSI private network and two are connected to an external enterprise network.

trans-unit.source: One of the external networks is reserved for cluster communications only.
trans-unit.target: One of the external networks is reserved for cluster communications only.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Database 2012 R2 (x64) + VMM 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Database 2012 R2 (x64) + VMM 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: The secondary site has a six-node failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: The secondary site has a six-node failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: Storage for the cluster node is provided by an iSCSI SAN.
trans-unit.target: Storage for the cluster node is provided by an iSCSI SAN.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Datacenter 2012 R2 (x64) + Hyper-V role

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Database 2012 R2 (x64) + VMM 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Database 2012 R2 (x64) + VMM 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: For test purposes we picked workloads commonly used in enterprise customer scenarios.
trans-unit.target: For test purposes we picked workloads commonly used in enterprise customer scenarios.

trans-unit.source: We use [IOMeter](http://www.iometer.org) with the workload characteristic summarized in the table for simulation.
trans-unit.target: We use [IOMeter](http://www.iometer.org) with the workload characteristic summarized in the table for simulation.

trans-unit.source: All IOMeter profiles are set to write random bytes to simulate worst-case write patterns for workloads.
trans-unit.target: All IOMeter profiles are set to write random bytes to simulate worst-case write patterns for workloads.

trans-unit.source: 470 virtual machines on the primary cluster.
trans-unit.target: 470 virtual machines on the primary cluster.

trans-unit.target: All virtual machines with VHDX disk.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines running workloads summarized in the table.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines running workloads summarized in the table.

trans-unit.source: All were created with VMM templates.
trans-unit.target: All were created with VMM templates.

trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery was configured for on-premises to on-premises protection

trans-unit.target: The VMM server has four clouds configured, containing the Hyper-V cluster servers and their virtual machines.
